leaf: Test for Hepatitis B surface antigen and hepatitis C antibody
paths: Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Baseline testing -> Conduct laboratory tests for the source patient -> Test for Hepatitis B surface antigen and hepatitis C antibody

leaf: Test for Hepatitis B core and surface antibody, surface antigen, and hepatitis C antibody. If source is high risk or known to be hepatitis C positive, consider hepatitis C RNA and ALT in exposed individual
paths: Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Baseline testing -> Conduct laboratory tests for the exposed patient -> Test for Hepatitis B core and surface antibody, surface antigen, and hepatitis C antibody. If source is high risk or known to be hepatitis C positive, consider hepatitis C RNA and ALT in exposed individual

leaf: Administer HBIG (0.6 ml/kg) within 72 hours and initiate vaccine series
paths: Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Intervention -> Determine if the exposed individual is nonimmune to Hepatitis B or a vaccine nonresponder after 1 series -> Administer Hepatitis B post-exposure prophylaxis for a high-risk event -> Administer HBIG (0.6 ml/kg) within 72 hours and initiate vaccine series||Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Intervention -> Determine if the exposed individual is a Hepatitis B vaccine nonresponder after 2 series -> Administer Hepatitis B post-exposure prophylaxis for a high-risk event -> Administer HBIG (0.6 ml/kg) within 72 hours and initiate vaccine series

leaf: No post-exposure prophylaxis is recommended as currently available agents have no proven benefit
paths: Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Intervention -> Determine if there was Hepatitis C exposure, regardless of risk level -> No post-exposure prophylaxis is recommended as currently available agents have no proven benefit

leaf: Repeat Hepatitis B panel at 4 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months. No follow-up testing required for hepatitis B if exposed has documented immunity
paths: Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Follow-up of exposed individual -> The source is Hepatitis B positive or from a high-risk group, and the exposed individual is nonimmune -> Repeat Hepatitis B panel at 4 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months. No follow-up testing required for hepatitis B if exposed has documented immunity

leaf: Test for Hepatitis C antibody at 4 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months. Consider hepatitis C RNA testing at 4 wk. For hepatitis C seroconversion, early referral to specialist is recommended
paths: Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Follow-up of exposed individual -> The source is Hepatitis C positive or from a high-risk group -> Test for Hepatitis C antibody at 4 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months. Consider hepatitis C RNA testing at 4 wk. For hepatitis C seroconversion, early referral to specialist is recommended
Decision tree for managing hepatitis exposure -> Follow-up of exposed individual -> The source is Hepatitis B and C negative -> No follow-up is warranted
